src:
Rekomendasi Film Akhir Pekan, 'Love for Sale 2'
01 Nov 2019, 17:17 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


'Love for Sale 2' dapat menjadi kawan bersantai di akhir pekan ini. (dok. Visinema Pictures)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Pekan pertama bulan November dihiasi dengan beberapa film baru, baik dalam negeri maupun internasional. Ada Love for Sale 2 sebagai film Indonesia dan ada Terminator: Dark Fate yang datang dari luar negeri.Selain itu sejumlah film horor juga masih bertengger di bioskop, seperti Perempuan Tanah Jahanam dan Lampor. Bagi yang belum menonton sebaiknya ke bioskop agar tidak kelewatan.Bila tidak ingin menyaksikan film bergenre cinta, laga atau horor, film animasi bisa menjadi pilihan. Seperti film The Addams Family, bercerita tentang keluarga Addams yang pindah ke New Jersey, namun ditolak tetangga.Berikut rekomendasi film akhir pekan ini dirangkum dari laman 21 Cineplex, Cinemaxx dan CGV Cinemas.Love for Sale 2Film ini bercerita tentang bujang lapuk bernama Indra Tauhid (Adipati Dolken). Ibunya, Rosmaida (Ratna Riantiatno), mendesak Indra untuk menikah karena sudah cukup usia.Indra sendiri nampak belum ingin menikah dan susah mencari pasangan yang cocok dengannya, walau sempat dekat dengan beberapa perempuan. Terlebih, hampir mustahil mencari calon istri yang cocok dengan sang ibu.Tekanan itu membuat Indra memutuskan mencari pasangan lewat aplikasi penyewaan pasangan bernama Love Inc. Ia menginginkan pasangan yang cantik dan paham agama, dan hadirlah Arini Chaniago (Della Dartyan).Film untuk DEWASA ini bisa disaksikan di seluruh jaringan bioskop Indonesia.



Terminator: Dark FateKisah robot dalam bentuk manusia, Cral, yang diperankan Arnold Schwarzenegger masih berlanjut dalam film Terminator: Dark Fate. Cerita kali ini fokus pada Carl dan Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton) dalam mengemban sebuah misi.Mereka harus melindungi seorang perempuan muda dari Terminator yang berasal dari masa depan. Jelas, misi itu tidak mudah karena mereka harus menghadapi manusia hybrid yang sangat kuat.Film untuk REMAJA ini bisa disaksikan di seluruh jaringan bioskop Indonesia.



Susi Susanti: Love AllSusi Susanti: Love All merupakan film biopik yang diangkat dari kisah kehidupan pebulutangkis legendaris Indonesia Susi Susanti. Kisah bermula dari kecintaan Susi kepada bulutangkis sejak kecil.Hingga ketika gejolak ekonomi terjadi dan melanda Indonesia, Susi menggunakan kesempatan tersebut untuk menunjukkan kepada negaranya dan dunia bahwa kepahlawanan tidak diukur oleh tingginya kesuksesan seseorang, tetapi oleh kedalaman pengorbanan.Film ini menampilkan perjuangan Susi kecil di Tasikmalaya, lalu berlatih keras di PB Jaya Raya dan kemudian masuk pelatnas PBSI. Selain itu, juga menggambarkan romansa Susi dengan Alan Budikusuma yang menjadi suaminya hingga kini.Film untuk SEMUA UMUR ini bisa disaksikan di seluruh jaringan bioskop Indonesia.



Zombieland: Double TapZombieland: Double Tap merupakan sekuel dari film Zombieland yang dirilis sekitar 10 tahun lalu.Sutradara Ruben Fleischer membuat empat anggota 'keluarga' utama Columbus (Woody Harrelson), Tallahassee (Jesse Eisenberg), Wichita (Emma Stone) and Little Rock (Abigail Breslin) melawan para zombie dalam perjalanan ke White House.Namun kali ini mereka juga harus berurusan dengan sekelompok orang yang juga selamat dari serangan zombie. Permasalahan bertambah ketika Little Rock berpisah dari rombongan karena terpikat dengan orang asing, Caprica (Avan Jogia).Film untuk DEWASA ini bisa disaksikan di seluruh jaringan bioskop Indonesia.



Maleficent: Mistress of EvilAngelina Jolie kembali ke layar lebar melalui Maleficent: Mistress of Evil. Film ini fokus pada Maleficent (Angelina Jolie) dan putri angkatnya Aurora (Elle Fanning) yang mulai berseteru dan mempertanyakan arti keluarga saat keduanya memiliki pandangan berbeda.Maleficent juga harus menghadapi masalah baru ketika ibu Pangeran Phillip, Ratu Ingrith ingin mengambil hak asuh Aurora dengan menjadikan sang putri sebagai istri dari anak lelakinya.Film untuk SEMUA UMUR ini bisa disaksikan di seluruh jaringan bioskop Indonesia




(adp/rea)
text:
Recommended Film Weekend, 'Love for Sale 2'
01 Nov 2019, 17:17 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


'Love for Sale 2' can be a relaxing companion this weekend. (doc. Visinema Pictures)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - The first week of November is decorated with several new films, both domestically and internationally. There is Love for Sale 2 as an Indonesian film and there is Terminator: Dark Fate coming from abroad. In addition, a number of horror films are still perched in theaters, such as the Woman's Land of Hell and Lampor. For those who have not watched it, you should go to the cinema so that you don't miss it. When you don't want to watch a love, action or horror movie, animated films can be an option. Like the film The Addams Family, tells the story of the Addams family who moved to New Jersey, but was rejected by neighbors. Following the film's recommendations this weekend are summarized from page 21 Cineplex, Cinemaxx and CGV Cinemas. Love for Sale 2 This film tells the story of a weathered bachelor named Indra Tauhid ( Duke of Dolken). Her mother, Rosmaida (Ratna Riantiatno), urges Indra to get married because she is old enough. Indra herself does not seem to want to get married and is difficult to find a suitable partner with her, even though she was close to several women. Moreover, it is almost impossible to find a suitable wife with the mother. The pressure made Indra decided to look for a partner through a partner rental application called Love Inc. He wants a beautiful and religious couple, and here comes Arini Chaniago (Della Dartyan). This film for ADULTS can be watched throughout the Indonesian cinema network.



Terminator: Dark Fate The story of a robot in human form, Cral, played by Arnold Schwarzenegger still continues in the movie Terminator: Dark Fate. The story this time focuses on Carl and Sarah Connor (Linda Hamilton) in carrying out a mission. They must protect a young woman from the Terminator who comes from the future. Obviously, the mission is not easy because they have to face a very strong hybrid human. The film for TEEN can be witnessed throughout the Indonesian cinema network.



Susi Susanti: Love AllSusi Susanti: Love All is a biopic film based on the life story of the legendary Indonesian badminton player Susi Susanti. The story begins with Susi's love for badminton since she was young. Until when economic turmoil broke out and hit Indonesia, Susi used the opportunity to show her country and the world that heroism was not measured by the height of one's success, but by the depth of sacrifice. The film featured a small Susi struggle in Tasikmalaya, then trained hard in PB Jaya Raya and then entered PBSI national training. In addition, it also depicts Susi's romance with Alan Budikusuma who has been her husband until now. The film for ALL AGES can be witnessed throughout the Indonesian cinema network.



Zombieland: Double Tap Zombieland: Double Tap is a sequel to the film Zombieland, which was released about 10 years ago. Director Ruben Fleischer made four major members of the Columbus (Woody Harrelson) family, Tallahassee (Jesse Eisenberg), Wichita (Emma Stone) and Little Rock (director) Abigail Breslin) against zombies on the way to the White House. But this time they also had to deal with a group of people who also survived the zombie attack. Problems escalated when Little Rock separated from the group because he was attracted to a foreigner, Caprica (Avan Jogia). This film for ADULTS can be watched throughout the Indonesian cinema network.



Maleficent: Mistress of Evil Angelina Jolie returns to the big screen via Maleficent: Mistress of Evil. The film focuses on Maleficent (Angelina Jolie) and her adopted daughter Aurora (Elle Fanning) who start fighting and question the meaning of family when both have different views. Maleficent also has to face new problems when Prince Phillip's mother, Queen Ingrith wants to take custody of Aurora by making Aurora the princess as the wife of her son. The film for ALL AGES can be watched throughout the Indonesian cinema network




(adp / rea)
